JoyPiAdvanced: Joy-Pi Advanced: Unleash your creativity with this compact, powerful device! Compatible with Micro:Bit, Raspberry Pi, Arduino & more, it features over 30 stations, lessons and modules, plus a learning hub for continuous improvement and project support.
JoyPiAdvanced.adcReadValue: Reads the value of the analog digital converter on a specified channel
JoyPiAdvanced.adcReadValue|param|channel: specifies the channel which is supposed to be read
JoyPiAdvanced.adcReadVoltage: Reads a channel on the analog digital converter and converts the value to a voltage number
JoyPiAdvanced.adcReadVoltage|param|chann: specifies the channel which is supposed to be read
JoyPiAdvanced.barometerGetPressure: Reads the ambient air pressure from the barometer
JoyPiAdvanced.barometerGetTemperature: Reads the ambient temperature from the barometer
JoyPiAdvanced.buttonmatrixPressed: Returns the the button-code if a button on the matrix is pressed
JoyPiAdvanced.buttonmatrixPressedValue: Returns the exact value if a button on the matrix is pressed
JoyPiAdvanced.buzzerOn: Turns on the buzzer with a selectable frequency
JoyPiAdvanced.buzzerOn|param|frequency: The frequency can be set from 100 (low pitch) to 20000 (high pitch)
JoyPiAdvanced.colorSensorGetBlue: Measures the blue component via the color sensor
JoyPiAdvanced.colorSensorGetGreen: Measures the green component via the color sensor
JoyPiAdvanced.colorSensorGetRed: Measures the red color component via the color sensor
JoyPiAdvanced.colorSensorGetWhite: Measures the white component via the color sensor
JoyPiAdvanced.eeepromWrite: Writes data to the EEPROM storage
JoyPiAdvanced.eeepromWrite|param|address: The address of the EEPROM where the data is supposed to be stored
JoyPiAdvanced.eeepromWrite|param|data: The data that is supposed to be written
JoyPiAdvanced.eepromRead: Reads data from the EEPROM storage
JoyPiAdvanced.eepromRead|param|address: The address of the EEPROM where the data is supposed to be read from
JoyPiAdvanced.gyroscopeGetTemperature: Reasds the ambient temperature from the gyroscope
JoyPiAdvanced.gyroscopeGetTilt: Reads the tilt direction of the gyroscope
JoyPiAdvanced.gyroscopeGetX: Measures the rotation on the X-axis with the gyroscope
JoyPiAdvanced.gyroscopeGetY: Measures the rotation of the Y-axis with the gyroscope
JoyPiAdvanced.hallSensorVoltage: Measures the voltage of the hall sensor. A higher value means a higher amplitude
JoyPiAdvanced.irButton: Returns the corresponding code as soon as an IR signal is received by the sensor
JoyPiAdvanced.joystickCheckButton: Checks the current button state of the joystick. True means that the button is pressed. False means that the button is not pressed.
JoyPiAdvanced.joystickGetXValue: Returns the current X-value of the joystick
JoyPiAdvanced.joystickGetYValue: Returns the current Y-value of the joystick
JoyPiAdvanced.lcd16x2BacklightOff: Turns off the backlight on the 16x2 LCD display
JoyPiAdvanced.lcd16x2BacklightOn: Turns on the backlight on the 16x2 LCD display
JoyPiAdvanced.lcd16x2Clear: Clears all outputs on the 16x2 LCD display
JoyPiAdvanced.lcd16x2HideCursor: Hides the cursor on its current position
JoyPiAdvanced.lcd16x2ReturnHome: Resets the cursor to its default position
JoyPiAdvanced.lcd16x2ShiftLeft: Shifts the current position to the left by 1 position
JoyPiAdvanced.lcd16x2ShiftRight: Shifts the current position to the right by 1 position
JoyPiAdvanced.lcd16x2ShowCursor: Shows the cursor on its current position
JoyPiAdvanced.lcd16x2ShowText: Shows a text on the 16x2 display
JoyPiAdvanced.lcd16x2ShowText|param|text: The text that is supposed to be displayed
JoyPiAdvanced.lcd16x2ShowText|param|x: The x position on the display from 0 (most left position) to 15 (most right position)
JoyPiAdvanced.lcd16x2ShowText|param|y: The y position on the display from 0 (upper line) to 1 (lower line)
JoyPiAdvanced.ldrLight: Measures the ambient light with the LDR sensor. The return value is the measured voltage. A higher value means a higher light intensity.
JoyPiAdvanced.lightBarrierIsTriggered: Checks the current state of the light barrier. True means that the light barrier is triggered. False means that its not triggered.
JoyPiAdvanced.lightBarrierRPM: Calculates the current RPM at the light barrier. This is usally combined with the stepper motor.
JoyPiAdvanced.matrixClear: Clears all outputs on the RGB martrix
JoyPiAdvanced.matrixRainbow: Activates a rainbow cycle on the RGB matrix
JoyPiAdvanced.matrixSetPixel: Sets a single pixel to a specific color
JoyPiAdvanced.matrixSetPixel|param|b: Blue value from 0 (no brightness of the blue base color) to 255 (full brightness of the blue base color)
JoyPiAdvanced.matrixSetPixel|param|g: Green value from 0 (no brightness of the green base color) to 255 (full brightness of the green base color)
JoyPiAdvanced.matrixSetPixel|param|r: Red value from 0 (no brightness of the red base color) to 255 (full brightness of the red base color)
JoyPiAdvanced.matrixShowColor: Sets the whole RGB matrix to a specific color
JoyPiAdvanced.matrixShowColor|param|b: Blue value from 0 (no brightness of the blue base color) to 255 (full brightness of the blue base color)
JoyPiAdvanced.matrixShowColor|param|g: Green value from 0 (no brightness of the green base color) to 255 (full brightness of the green base color)
JoyPiAdvanced.matrixShowColor|param|r: Red value from 0 (no brightness of the red base color) to 255 (full brightness of the red base color)
JoyPiAdvanced.measureDistance: Measures the distance with the ultrasonic sensor
JoyPiAdvanced.ntcTemperature: Measures the ambient temperature with the NTC sensor. The return value is the measured voltage. A higher value means a higher temperature.
JoyPiAdvanced.oledClear: Clears all outputs on the OLED display
JoyPiAdvanced.oledDrawCircle: Draws a circle on the OLED display
JoyPiAdvanced.oledDrawCircle|param|x: X coordinate of the start position
JoyPiAdvanced.oledDrawCircle|param|y: Y coordinate of the start position
JoyPiAdvanced.oledDrawLine: Draws a line on the OLED display
JoyPiAdvanced.oledDrawLine|param|x0: X coordinate of the start position
JoyPiAdvanced.oledDrawLine|param|x1: X coordinate of the end position
JoyPiAdvanced.oledDrawLine|param|y0: Y coordinate of the start position
JoyPiAdvanced.oledDrawLine|param|y1: Y coordinate of the end position
JoyPiAdvanced.oledDrawRectangle: Draws a rectangle on the OLED display
JoyPiAdvanced.oledDrawRectangle|param|x: X coordinate of the start position
JoyPiAdvanced.oledDrawRectangle|param|y: Y coordinate of the start position
JoyPiAdvanced.oledShowString: Shows a string on the OLED display
JoyPiAdvanced.oledShowString|param|str: The string which is supposed to be displayed
JoyPiAdvanced.pirCheckMotion: Returns the current state of the PIR sensor. True means that a motion is detected. False means that no motion is detected.
JoyPiAdvanced.potentiometerVoltage: Measures the current state of the potentiometer as a voltage. A higher voltage means that the potentiometer is positioned further to the right
JoyPiAdvanced.pwmSetSpeed: Sets the speed of the PWM fan. Please note that the PWM fan needs to be in PWM mode.
JoyPiAdvanced.pwmSetSpeed|param|speed: The speed in percentage from 0 (off) to 100 (full speed)
JoyPiAdvanced.readDS18B20: Measures temperature with the DS18B20 sensor. Please note that this is an external sensor that needs to be connected first!
JoyPiAdvanced.rfidWriteText|param|text: A string that is supposed to be written to the RFID device
JoyPiAdvanced.rotaryEncoderonPressEvent: Event that is executed as soon as the rotary encoder is pressed
JoyPiAdvanced.rotaryEncoderonTurned: Event that is executed as soon as the rotary encoder is turned in the corresponding direction
JoyPiAdvanced.rtcGetDay: Reads the current day from the RTC
JoyPiAdvanced.rtcGetHour: Reads the current hour from the RTC
JoyPiAdvanced.rtcGetMinute: Reads the current minute from the RTC
JoyPiAdvanced.rtcGetMonth: Reads the current month from the RTC
JoyPiAdvanced.rtcGetSecond: Reads the current second from the RTC
JoyPiAdvanced.rtcGetWeekday: Reads the current weekday from the RTC
JoyPiAdvanced.rtcGetYear: Reads the current year from the RTC
JoyPiAdvanced.rtcSetDateTime: Sets all paramters to the RTC
JoyPiAdvanced.rtcSetDay: Sets the day to the RTC
JoyPiAdvanced.rtcSetHour: Sets the hour to the RTC
JoyPiAdvanced.rtcSetMinute: Sets the minute to the RTC
JoyPiAdvanced.rtcSetMonth: Sets the month to the RTC
JoyPiAdvanced.rtcSetSecond: Sets the second to the RTC
JoyPiAdvanced.rtcSetWeekday: Sets the weekday to the RTC
JoyPiAdvanced.rtcSetYear: Sets the year to the RTC
JoyPiAdvanced.segmentClear: Clear all outputs on the 7-segment display
JoyPiAdvanced.segmentWriteNumber: Write a number to the 7-segment display
JoyPiAdvanced.segmentWriteNumber|param|c: whether the colon in the center of the display should be displayed or not
JoyPiAdvanced.segmentWriteNumber|param|n: the number which is supposed to be displayed. Maximum of 4 digits is possible
JoyPiAdvanced.shocksensorCheck: Reads the current state of the shock sensor. True means that a shock was recognized. False means that no shock was recognized.
JoyPiAdvanced.soundsensorCheck: Checks the current state of the sound sensor. True means that a sound was detected. False means that no sound was detected.
JoyPiAdvanced.stepperRotate: Rotates the stepper motor by a specified amount of steps or rotations
JoyPiAdvanced.stepperRotate|param|direct: The direction in which the motor should turn (clockwise or counterclockwise)
JoyPiAdvanced.stepperRotate|param|steps: The amount the motor is supposed to turn
JoyPiAdvanced.stepperRotate|param|unit: The unit the motor is suppoed to turn (steps or full rotations)
JoyPiAdvanced.switchCheck: Checks the current state of a switch. True means that the switch is set to ON. False means that the switch is set to OFF.
JoyPiAdvanced.switchCheck|param|JoyPiSwi: The switch which is supposed to be checked
JoyPiAdvanced.tftClear: Clears all outputs on the TFT
JoyPiAdvanced.tftDrawCircle: Draws a circle on the TFT
JoyPiAdvanced.tftDrawCircle|param|x: X coordinate of the circle center point
JoyPiAdvanced.tftDrawCircle|param|y: Y coordinate of the circle center point
JoyPiAdvanced.tftDrawLine: Draws a straight line on the TFT
JoyPiAdvanced.tftDrawLine|param|x0: X coordinate of the start point
JoyPiAdvanced.tftDrawLine|param|x1: X coordinate of the end point
JoyPiAdvanced.tftDrawLine|param|y0: Y coordinate of the start point
JoyPiAdvanced.tftDrawLine|param|y1: Y coordinate of the end point
JoyPiAdvanced.tftDrawPixel: Draws a single pixel on the TFT
JoyPiAdvanced.tftDrawRectangle: Draws a rectangle on the TFT
JoyPiAdvanced.tftDrawRectangle|param|x: X coordinate of the start point
JoyPiAdvanced.tftDrawRectangle|param|y: Y coordinate of the start point
JoyPiAdvanced.tftShowString: Write a text on the TFT
JoyPiAdvanced.tftShowString|param|text: String that is supposed to be written
JoyPiAdvanced.tftShowString|param|x: X coordinate of the start point
JoyPiAdvanced.tftShowString|param|y: Y coordinate of the start point
JoyPiAdvanced.tftShowString|param|zoom: Zoom level of the text from 1 (small text) to 5 (large text)
JoyPiAdvanced.touchSensorCheck: Checks the current state of the touch sensor. True means that the touch sensor is triggered. False means that the touch sensor is not triggered.
JoyPiAdvanced.touchSensorCheck|param|sen: The sensor that is supposed to be checked from 1 (upper sensor) to 6 (lower sensor)
JoyPiAdvanced.turnMotor: Rotates the servo motor to a specified angle
JoyPiAdvanced.turnMotor|param|degrees: The angle position which is supposed to be driven from 0 (most left) to 180 (most right)
